keyPolicies.policyDescription: Alan Whitehead is calling on the Tories to address this injustice concerning the change in the state pension age for women born in the 1950s. He demands transitional arrangements for those affected and pledges to continue fighting for the rights of WASPI (Women Against State Pension Inequality) women if re-elected.

issues.socialWelfare: Fighting against state pension age changes that have negatively affected women born in the 1950s, demanding justice and transitional arrangements.

contactInformation.address: Labour Central, Kings Manor, Newcastle upon Tyne NE1 6PA

endorsements.endorsement: Thank you @alanwhiteheadmp for all your support. Much appreciated.

quotes.text: Women have been treated very badly with these pension changes. We need a Labour government to sort this out.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Alan Whitehead's campaign is particularly focused on pension reforms affecting women born in the 1950s.
